patterns: How can I make a custom component using Angular CLI?
What is the command for creating an Angular component?
responses: To create a custom Angular component, navigate to the terminal. In the terminal, navigate to the location of the root folder of your project. Then simply run the ng generate component command followed by the name of the new component.
Creating custom Angular components can be achieved using the ng generate component <new_component_name> command or ng g c <new_component_name> for short!

patterns: What is the Ng Model attribute directive?
Is there an Angular directive that enables two-way binding?
responses: Angular NgModel is an inbuilt directive that creates a FormControl instance from the domain model and binds it to a form control element, or in other words, it enables two-way binding.
The NgModel directive binds an HTML form element to a variable in the scope, enabling two-way binding. If the variable does not exist in the scope, it will be created.

patterns: Can I have duplicate values in my Python list?
Do the values in my python list have to be distinct?
responses: Since Python lists are indexed, lists can have items with the same value. Just remember to put keep its values in the square brackets.
A Python list may contain duplicate values with their distinct positions and hence, multiple distinct or duplicate values can be passed as a sequence at the time of list creation.

patterns: How can I sort a Python list by the date?
responses: Sorting a Python list by date can be achieved by using the Lambda function as well as the time package. Simply provide the list you’d like to sort and utilise the strptime method to format and return a string that represents the date.

patterns: Can you help me sort dates by ascending order in Python 3?
responses: Try asc_sorted_data = sorted(<list_name>, key=lambda x: time.strptime(x['date_value'], '%d-%m-%Y')) in your Python code to sort dates in ascending order.

patterns: What does SQL stand for?
What does structured query language mean?
responses: Structured Query Language, or SQL for short, is a computer language that we use to interact with a relational database. SQL is a tool for organizing, managing, and retrieving archived data from a computer database (https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/what-is-sql/, 2023).

SQL is a standardized programming language that is used to manage relational databases and perform various operations on the data in them (https://www.techtarget.com/searchdatamanagement/definition/SQL, n.d).

patterns: What is the SQL statement to remove duplicate values for a database table?
Is there an SQL command to return the different values in a database tuple?
responses: The SELECT DISTINCT statement will remove dupliatre values from a database table, visit https://www.w3schools.com/Sql/sql_distinct.asp for more information.
To return all of the different values from your database table, try SELECT DISTINCT column_name, ... FROM table_name;
